item.title: Presentations
item.description:
Introductory Hello, friends! Today I want to share some tips on creating effective presentations that will help you keep your audience’s attention and get your ideas across.

Purpose and structure.

First of all, determine the main purpose of your presentation. What do you want the audience to remember? Structure the material so that so that it flows logically and supports that goal.

Clear and concise slides

Use slides as a means of supporting your presentation, not as a literal translation. Key phrases and visual images will help the audience absorb the information better.

Good visuals

Visuals such as diagrams, graphics and images should be high-quality and relevant. They should emphasize and complement your speech, not distract attention.

Interactivity

Include interactive elements, such as questions to the audience or mini-polls. This will help to keep attention and make your presentation more dynamic .

Rehearsal.

Don’t forget to rehearse your presentation thoroughly. This will help you feel more confident, and will also help you perfect your timing and make sure all technical aspects are working properly.

Feedback

After your presentation, if possible, collect feedback. This will help you improve your skills and make your next presentations even more successful.

Summary

And remember, every audience is unique. Your presentations should be tailored to the interests and expectations of the audience you are speaking to.

Last week my days were full of interesting discoveries and challenges. I made the decision to return to programming, and it was an incredibly exciting experience. Kotlin

Android development

After that, I decided to return to Android development. Returning to this platform was like meeting an old friend. I remembered all my previous projects, I was excited to dive back into the world of mobile development.

I still touch the grass sometimes

It wasn’t just programming that took up my time last week. I even went outside a couple of times to get some fresh air and relax after a hard day of work. It helped me to refresh and restore energy for new achievements.

Astra Linux

In addition, I started studying the AstraLinux course. It’s a fun activity that helps me better understand how Linux works internally. Each new module of the course opens up new horizons for me in the world of operating systems and computer security.

No rest this week :/

However, despite all my busyness, I found , that I have very little time for rest and entertainment. My schedule was so tight that I could hardly enjoy watching cartoons or anime, which I love so much.

Summary

So, the past week was filled with exciting discoveries and challenges. Return I found my introduction to programming to be an exciting and fulfilling experience that I can’t wait to continue next week.

item.description:
Introduction

Programming is often mentioned in an applied context. It seems that with its help they create only mobile applications, Internet systems and special effects for cinema. But programming was originally intended to solve scientific problems. In addition, programming itself is a science, which will be useful to learn about for those who have decided to connect their career with computer development.

Scientific programming

Scientific programming — a highly oriented programming style for scientific calculations. It differs from other types of programming by the extreme correctness and stability of the final product, strict separation of the scientific and interface parts, individuality of algorithms, and the prevalence of efficiency over universality.

Scientific programming is the basis of any modern global research. All advanced technologies, from quantum computers to space programs, would be impossible without specialists in scientific programming, who can provide scientists with a reliable and accurate tool for making discoveries.

A number of branches of science directly depend on the level of development of scientific programming. For example, unmanned transport is waiting for its implementation , “smart” systems for managing urban and agricultural industries, stock exchanges; robotics, genetic engineering, artificial intelligence that surpasses human capabilities are waiting.

Specializations

Scientists use various programming languages, the choice of which depends on the type of task and the author’s preferences. Historically, the first high-level language programming is Fortran, many debugged libraries of mathematical statistics and libraries for solving differential equations are written in it, which is relevant for economics and biology, respectively. Python has a simpler syntax, which is also suitable for programming mathematical calculations. The Python language is used to process data in mathematics, physics, economics, biology, chemistry and can work with some other “scientific” languages: Fortran, C++, C#.

In turn, C# allows programming on the .NET platform, adapting the program to the common language execution environment (CLR) and accelerate development through rapid scientific sessions.

item.title: What is CI/CD
item.description:
Introduction

You’ve probably heard the term “CI/CD”, but what what is it really? In simple terms, CI/CD is a technique that helps programmers build software faster and more safely. Let’s take a closer look.

What is Continuous Integration (CI)?

Continuous Integration is a process in which Code written by different programmers is combined into one place where it can be tested automatically. This allows errors and conflicts between different parts of the code to be detected at the early stages of development. Every time a programmer makes a change to the code and pushes it to a version control system (like Git), the CI server automatically picks up the code, builds it, and runs a set of tests to make sure everything works as expected.

What is continuous delivery (CD)?

Continuous delivery is a step further. Once code has been successfully integrated and tested on the CI server, the CD server takes that code and automatically deploys it to servers ready for clients to use. This means that every time a programmer makes changes, these changes can be automatically deployed to servers without any additional manual actions.

Why do we need CI/CD?

CI/CD helps make the software development process more efficient and reliable. Here are some reasons why it is important:

  1. Fast feedback: CI/CD allows for quick detection of errors and issues in the code. This allows programmers to fix them early in the development process, saving time and resources.

  2. Security: Automated code testing on the CI server helps identify potential security issues before they reach production.

  3. Consistency: Automated deployment on the CD server ensures that every time the code passes the tests, it is deployed to the servers in the same way. in a way that prevents unexpected issues from arising due to differences in environments.

  4. Accelerated development cycle: With CI/CD, developers can quickly and frequently release software updates, which helps them respond to market changes and user demands.

Summary

In conclusion, CI/CD is a powerful tool that helps make software development more efficient, reliable, and flexible. Understanding this methodology can help developers create quality software faster and better.

item.title: What is LaTeX
item.description:
Introduction

Hello, friends! Today I want to share with you one of my favorite tools for creating beautifully designed documents - LaTeX!

What is LaTeX

LaTeX is a scientific and technical typesetting system that is widely used in the academic world, scientific research, publishing articles, books and more. It allows you to create high-quality documents with a professional appearance.

Advantages

One of the main reasons why I like LaTeX is its convenience and flexibility. Unlike regular text editors, LaTeX uses a markup language that allows more precise control over the formatting of a document. This allows you to create complex mathematical formulas, tables , images and more with minimal effort. Another great advantage of LaTeX is its ability to automatically generate tables of contents, bibliographies, references, and many other elements. This greatly simplifies the process of creating large and structured documents.

Open Source

In addition, LaTeX is open source software and is available free of charge to all. There are many various distributions and add-on packages that allow you to extend its functionality to suit your needs.

Summary

If you are new to LaTeX but are interested in creating beautifully formatted documents, I highly recommend that you learn the system. There are many online resources, tutorials, and communities that will help you master the basics of LaTeX and start creating professional documents today.

item.title: What is Linux
item.description:
What is Linux

Linux is the general name for UNIX-like operating systems based on the same name kernel and the libraries and system programs compiled for it, developed within the framework of the GNU project. GNU/Linux runs on PC-compatible systems of the Intel x86 family, as well as on IA-64, AMD64, PowerPC, ARM and many others.

To the GNU/ operating system Linux also often includes programs that complement this operating system and applications that make it a full-fledged multifunctional operating environment. Unlike most other operating systems, GNU/Linux does not have a single “official” package. Instead, GNU/Linux comes in a large number of so-called distributions, which bundle GNU programs with the Linux kernel and other programs.

Development

Unlike Microsoft Windows, Mac OS, and commercial UNIX-like systems, GNU/Linux has no geographical center development. There is no organization that owns this system; there is not even a single coordinating center. Linux programs are the result of thousands of projects. Some of these projects are centralized, some are concentrated in companies. Many projects unite hackers from all over the world who know each other only by correspondence. Anyone can create their own project or join an existing one, and if successful, the results of the work will become known to millions of users. Users take part in testing free programs, communicate with developers directly, which allows them to quickly find and fix errors and implement new features. It is precisely this flexible and dynamic development system, impossible for closed-source projects, that determines the exceptional economic efficiency of GNU/Linux. Low cost of free development, well-established testing and distribution mechanisms, involvement of people from different countries with different views on the problems, protection of the code by the GPL license - all this became the reason for the success of free programs. Of course, such high efficiency of development could not fail to interest large companies, which became open their own projects. This is how Mozilla (Netscape, AOL), OpenOffice.org (Sun), the free clone of Interbase (Borland) — Firebird, SAP DB (SAP) appeared. IBM contributed to the porting of GNU/Linux to its mainframes. On the other hand, the open code significantly reduces the cost of developing closed systems for GNU/Linux and allows to reduce the price of the solution for the user. That is why GNU/Linux has become a platform often recommended for such products as Oracle, DB2, Informix, SyBase, SAP R3, Domino.

Application The distribution area of ​​Linux is huge, much larger than that of all other operating systems. In addition to the fact that Linux works great on regular home and work computers and servers, there are adaptations of Linux for most modern processors, which allows the use of systems with the Linux kernel in network equipment, home “smart” equipment, robots, mobile phones, various portable devices, etc. other hardware that supports programmable operations.

Ultimately, such a wide range of supported devices means excellent portability of programs. For example, the same application can often be run with minimal effort on both a regular computer and a Linux-based mobile phone. For example: Windows and its younger brother Windows Mobile are completely incompatible platforms.
